Technical Aspects:
Clearly illustrate the technical aspects through flowcharts and the tech stack. Ensure each component is logically connected and explained succinctly.

The problem statement emphasizes using blockchain in voting systems for its tamperproof capabilities. Introducing an offline mechanism with EVM machines undermines this core benefit, as blockchain's security relies on real-time, immutable records. For example, blockchain ensures vote integrity and transparency, which offline EVMs cannot provide. A better approach is to use blockchain-based mobile or web applications for secure, real-time voting which you have actually given. The use of IR blasters is outdated compared to modern security mechanisms. Cryptographic techniques like public key infrastructure (PKI) and end-to-end encryption are far more secure for voter authentication and vote protection. IR blasters introduce unnecessary complexity and vulnerabilities to the entire voting system.To fully leverage blockchain's potential, focus on secure digital authentication and real-time online voting to ensure the highest security and trust in the voting system, aligning with the problem statement's intent.

The presentation is not well organized, better fonts could have been used. The usage of opencv is not explained at all. Usage of IR blasters can provide a layer of security but is limited by detection accuarcy and deployment complexity.

Technical Relevance:
The work is good, and the technical relevance is mostly appropriate. The tech stack mentioned is adequate.                                                                                      
Flowchart Detail:
The flowchart could have been more detailed and visually appealing.
Blockchain Concerns:
The solution lacks clarity on managing blockchain transaction delays, which could cause issues with concurrency.
Offline and Online Voting:
The approach to cross-verify voter IDs for conflict avoidance is a good idea, but it needs to address how concurrent conflicts will be handled.
Details on the distribution and handling of offline EVMs are missing.

column5: HG0206 - EAGER EAGLES - PPT - SAKTHI MUKESH T 231801145. pptx.pptx
column17: The problem is addressed properly by leveraging ML techniques to fine-tune/use a pre-trained model such as DenseNet, enhancing accuracy in identifying scans and measurements. However, there are areas for improvement. Firstly, is the usage of DenseNet itself. There are other alternative options for these such as ResNet and EfficientNet which perform much better than DenseNet. Also there's a lack of validation; integrating features like sending reports to doctors for review or including confidence scores for each output can enhance decision-making, as AI isn't always infallible. Additionally, ensuring model decisions are interpretable using tools like Grad-CAM can provide valuable insights to healthcare professionals. You can also check for open source models for these in HuggingFace which are already available for better understanding. The flowchart diagram could have been much better, and the PPT was not visually appealing

Everything about your project is amazing…the idea, the innovation and the mentioning of the algorithm used to train the respective model is appreciated. The only flaw and which is considered to be an important one is the presentation itself. The presentation is not visually appealing at all. The abstract could have been made as a well aligned paragraph without the inclusion of conclusion and so on. The flow chart need a lot of work as it doesn't have any pictorial representation at all to describe the process. Since the ppt is the first part of evaluation, if it is not visually appealing then the evaluators wouldn't even bother checking the contents in the presentation.

Problem Relevance and Impact: The presentation addresses a highly relevant and impactful problem with an innovative and appropriate solution,
Feasibility and Scalability: Strong, but require attention to computational resources and data quality,
Overall Improvements: the flow diagram could be more visually represented for better understanding

column4: AI-Powered Mental Health Chatbot with Suicide Prevention Support
column5: HG0219 - Cyber Knightz - SAKTHI ELUMALAI MANICKAVELU 231401091.pptx
column17: The idea doesn't fully address the problem as outlined in your PPT. One major issue is how users will access or use the chatbot. For instance, a person who is mentally distressed may not feel comfortable discussing their issues with anyone, let alone with an AI chatbot. AI lacks the ability to truly understand a person's emotional state as a human would. Therefore, assuming that someone will automatically come to the platform and initiate a conversation with the chatbot might be unrealistic. Additionally, the PPT did not specify how the chatbot will be built or the approach that might be taken. It’s important to outline the development process, including the technologies and methodologies to be used. Moreover, even if the system connects users with mental health professionals, there are several ways this system could be misused or abused. Addressing these issues is crucial to ensure the platform’s effectiveness and safety.

Much effort wasent put into the presentation at all. The explaination of the project and the solution itself is very simple and is not explained in detail. The algorithm used and how the solution is implemented is not mentioned.

The presentation lacks sufficient effort and detail. The project explanation and solution are overly simplistic and lack comprehensive detail. Additionally, the algorithm used and the implementation process are not mentioned.

PPT could have been improved, but the video made up for it, which was a plus for me. However, the issue is the usage of Gemini Vision models. While prompt engineering has shown better accuracy with fine-tuning approaches, Gemini isn’t fine-tuned for medical analysis and report generation. One-shot and zero-shot learning refer to methods where the model is trained with very few examples (one-shot) or no examples at all (zero-shot) for a specific task, which might not be suitable for complex medical tasks. Using a custom DL model might be useful but would require substantial resources to construct your encoder-decoder architecture for transformers. Additionally, scalability is a concern, given the stringent HIPAA compliance for handling medical images. The project aims to build a safe and responsible AI system to detect anomalies, but this aspect seems missing. For a more effective implementation, a detailed flowchart would help illustrate the data processing and model integration steps better. Furthermore, ensuring robust validation of your models and addressing security concerns should be prioritized to enhance the overall reliability and compliance of the system.

Presentation could have been better and customised model is very important when it comes to medical field whereas gemini like LLM are more generalised, you could have built a custom trained model instead of gemini.

They will face a lot of prblems while integrating and maintaing multiple technologies. The presentation could be more detailed but the effort put into the video is appreciated. The integration of Gemini AI and Google Vision API will be a problem. There's more space for refinement and improvement. Flowchart needs to be detailed and more visualisation is needed.

Good presentation,but idea itself is fine but the approach is not explained , what iot sensors?, where they are implemented?,the server side architecture is not explained, if you are using aadhar card no or drivers license what about data security,seems unnecessary. overall good presentation,lacks depth.

column4: Telemedicine Platform for Maternal and Child Health in Rural Areas
column17: The idea is good but how the idea is to be implemented is not explained at all. How the health metrices are monitored, offline mode, chatbot implementation are just mentioned. Your approach used for the Use Cases and Flowchart can be improved.

Content seem to be a bit GPT generated, could have been a bit elaborative in the idea solution on how do you plan on implementing. Along with a flowchart, an architecture diagram would have been better.

Avoid providing abstract in points. There is no clear explaination about the implementation plan. Flowchart must contain the clear architecture of the project with relevant images or icons. The provided solution is not very feasible in rural areas.

column4: Al-Based Pest Detection and Control System
column17:
Great research work, Appreciable video explanation
It is suggested to frame flowcharts with better clarity, 
Need to focus on developing a whole product including frontend and databases with a real-time ML model,

Need to include methods on how alerts and messages are received to the user, Solution needs more remidial measures for pest control for the farmer rather than providing more information regarding detection, Scalability and cost optimization techniques need to be improved , Flowchart must be more detailed

a ppt should never contain such huge paragraphs. You mentioned 24h monitoring but failed to mention how you will capture and process images in night time. Also you would need several high quality cameras to detect pests in acres of farmland which also means the electricity requirement is too high. Most farmers don't have smart phones hence all the '-"UI for farmers" that you mentioned is useless most of the time.

Presentation is completely filled with text there's no pictorial representation in it. The flowchart looks like it explains more about your ML algorithm, not your solution. Tech stack is good but not quite feasible and appropriate for your solution. There's no clear definition of your AI/ML model, and the project doesn't seem certain and addressing the problem statement appropriately.

The presentation dont't have much illustartions to explain what they are really trying to implement. Also the flow chart is not structured well. Also it seems they aren't clear with the tech-stack they are about to use. But I like the idea of suggesting unique places.
The content and solution generated using AI and the given solution does not have any clarity about the technical implementation.

Presentation is completely filled with text; there's no pictorial representation in it. The flowchart doesn't seem legit; guess you guys misunderstood the term flowchart. Tech stack is good but not quite feasible and appropriate for your solution. There's no clear definition of your AI/ML model, and the project doesn't seem certain and addressing the problem statement appropriately.
The idea is good, The flowchart is AI generated so there is it not any explaination about the tech stack and the working more.

column4: AI-Assisted Telemedicine kiosk for rural India
column17: Really a great presentation with an illustrative flowchart and clear point-to-point explanation, Your business canvas model was well-designed with a comprehensive competitive analysis, showing the hard work put into your research, The only area for improvement is the tech stack. Instead of using Firebase, creating your own server could minimize costs.

One of the best presentations that i have come across, from the video till the business model canvas. For a MVP pov this is an amazing solution, but in terms of scalability if you guys were to deploy this as a product, using Google products such as gemini and gmaps will increase the cost as a whole.

Everything was fine. The way the represented their idea and their video was really impressive. But only down side is they seem to be limiting themselves with techstack. When it comes to scalability, it may be very difficult. The RND was great. they have clear idea about the market.

Great research work with good features, 
Need to work more on scalable solutions implementable in all use cases,
It is suggested to include pictures in your flowcharts, 
Try including a business point of view to the project,

The presentation was well-structured and clearly defined. However, the flow diagram would benefit from more detailed visual explanations. Additionally, a more comprehensive explanation of the AI/ML technology and its working mechanism is necessary for better understanding.

The PPT can be more visually appealing; consider including more graphics and reducing text,
Content could be more concise,
The flowchart can be more structured and  can  include architecture details,
Seems to be generated by GPT. The idea itself is not very different from existing fitness applications. The presentation is not visually appealing and the flow chart needs to improve a lot.
There is no innovation in your solution. You need to elaborate more on how you will use your ML models. The flow chart need to be better

column4: AI-Powered Nutrition Deficiency Detection and Management
column17: Size of the abstract can be narrowed down. Good flowchart and Business Canvas model.

You guys already developed the prototype of your product, which is much appreciable. But the presentation is kinda cluttery with text; some more pictorial representation is encouraged. The BMC is good, and you guys have a reliable revenue stream. Kudos for the YouTube video!
The solution and the youtube video was good, but the textual content in the presentation can be reduced.
Your Solution is good,the flowchat needs to be more detailed with additional features , the tech stack does not mentain any hardware or iot material

Your solution is fine, but powering up your system with piezoelectric current is not feasible. Even though using it as a backup, it's not recommended because it can't produce a stable voltage, and you need to use supercapacitors to store the current generated, which is really expensive. The tech stack is not clear, and there is a lack of structural information about your solution. Flow chart could have been improved, and your tech stack might not even address some basic requirements to build your solution (no offense).

column4: Digital Technology for Non-Revenue Water (NRW ) Management

Architecture diagram is well done, the business model is goodand props to the video. Explain more about the ML and real-time alerts. The content is looking a little over the top and seems AI generated. Try to clearly define the content and list options making it more visually appealing. Overall a good presentation.
Content seems to be generated by GPT. Architecture Diagram is amazing, but could have been a bit original. Could use a bit of new age tech stack to keep up with scalability.
The idea itself and usage of Splunk is impressive. The flowchart is well done. Addition of business idea is appericiated.
Everything on the backend was good. But I'm not sure how they are going to monitor clients device status with just html and js. Using some native code would solve this

The flow diagram would greatly benefit from more detailed and visually engaging explanations. Additionally, providing a more comprehensive explanation of the hardware and software components, along with their working structures, is essential for a clearer understanding.
Provide the abstract as a short paragraph. The content is too lengthy and flow chart is very basic.

Maybe consider making the content more concise and less AI-generated,
You might want to clearly define the tech stack instead of listing options,
Consider structuring the flowchart with system architecture details and making the presentation more visually appealing,

Flowchart can be done better. Its good that you have already developed your prototype. It would be good if you had included the implementation plan as i don't know how well your proposed user experience and tech stack would suit the people in rural areas.

column4: Digital Technology for Non-Revenue Water (NRW) Management

column17: Your Flowchart is explained well with good features, the video was informative and the overal idea and presenation is greate. And the addition of bussiness model canvas was well provide the overal l product cost . Work more on product seurity and future scaliablity.

column2: Presentation is filled with text; some more pictorial representation is appreciated. Flowcharts should be clearer and should exactly define and represent your solution in a graphical manner, which is lacking. I'm quite not sure about the satellite access for PocketQubes unless you're an institution or a government body. Using Poniccio for creating a scatternet or piconet mesh network is quite not possible in cases of deciduous or tropical forests, and the transmission speed is also really slow if you can't connect it with a proper 433kHz antenna.
column17: Presentation is filled with text; some more pictorial representation is appreciated. Flowcharts should be clearer and should exactly define and represent your solution in a graphical manner, which is lacking. I'm quite not sure about the satellite access for PocketQubes unless you're an institution or a government body. Using Poniccio for creating a scatternet or piconet mesh network is quite not possible in cases of deciduous or tropical forests, and the transmission speed is also really slow if you can't connect it with a proper 433kHz antenna.

Enhancing the flow diagram with more detailed and visually appealing elements would be beneficial. Additionally, a thorough explanation of the hardware and software components and their operational structures is crucial for better clarity

The transmission and bandwith limitations. will be a major problem. Pocketqubes mesh network's effectiveness will be easly disrupted by the terrain. More detail needed on the hardware integration and the flowchart needs to be more visually appealing along with more details. Good presentation overall but lacks structure and try to add business model to it.
